channel.title: Request
channel.description:
Alright i need a script that can select some text (maybe use a bitmap?) because a normal mouse macro will not work.
The interface is like...
You must move your mouse to "Mining" then a window comes out to the right, and you have to select the desired option. (In this case, Mine)
Only problem is, every time you right click to get the menu to pop up, or go down to "Mining" the windows change position in a random direction by a few pixels, witch makes normal macro's not work with it.
So what i am asking for is a script that will first, go to "Mining ->" then select "Mine" from the other window that pops up, i was thinking you could do it by using a bitmap or something, or asking it to find the text on the screen, i really don't know much about SCAR, so i don't know how to do this.
Also, after it clicks "Mine" i need it to wait about 16-19 seconds and run the script over.
Thank you, Cj.

item.title: Request
item.dc:creator: @CJg CJg
item.description:
@CJg wrote:

Well, i don’t really want to say the game, since im using the same name as i use in-game, and i know people here play it.

Just don’t wanna take the chance ;p

Ill pm the name to you though.

Read full topic

item.title: Request
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

First off, what game is this your making this script for?

And also, make a bitmap of that message, and if it finds it, give it coords to click at or soemthing.

In runescape, there is a function to find text, but the numbers and letters in your game may be different so Ide think youd need bitmaps or soemthing.

And if you need to push escape and the ok button, do this i believe:

KeyDown(25); Wait(whatever you want); //look for the ok button here;

Read full topic

item.title: Request
item.dc:creator: @CJg CJg
item.description:
@CJg wrote:

Ok, here is what ive come up with. (Can’t test it, the game server crashed 5 mins after i was finishing it, heh, ironic.)

I added the human movements and clicks that i found in the help file, and noticed this is pretty easy

What i would like to add next is an anti-random detection, sometimes while mining you can get “Your pickaxe get’s stuck in the rock!” and you have to move around a little, would there be a way to do this without adding more bitmap detection?

Another thing i would like to do is if it finds the word macro anywhere in the client (Would i need another bitmap detection?) then it stops the script, and logs out (pressing esc, then clicking a yes box.)

{.Script Info:
# ScriptName  = Wurm Mine
# Author      = Cjg
# Description = Wurm online mining macro
# Version     = 1.0.0
# Date        = Tuesday, April 24, 2007
# Comments    = Have fun with it :)
/Script Info}
program Mine;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}
var
  mine : Integer;
  mine2 : Integer;
Procedure LoadBitmaps; //this loads the bitmaps so they can be used later in the script.
  begin
  mine := BitmapFromString(29, 1, 'z78DA73730301033070A3808D0' +
       'CA8A51E590402007BEF2755');

  mine2 := BitmapFromString(21, 1, 'z78DA73730301033070A3808D' +
       '0C30D5E002003AAF1DD1');
end;

Procedure FindWall;
begin
  if(Findcolor(x,y,1447958, 400, 200, 516, 338))then
  begin
ClickMouseSpline(x, y, 3, 3, False);
    Wait(6000);
  end;
end;

Procedure MoveToMine;
begin
  if(FindBitMap(mine, x, y))then
  begin
    MMouse(x, y, 0, 0);
    Wait(3000);
  end else //if it doesnt find the bitmap
  begin
    Writeln('Did not find first bitmap, ending script!');
    Terminatescript;
  end;
  FreeBitmap(mine)
end;

Procedure ClickMine;
begin
  if(FindBitmap(mine2, x, y)) then
  begin
    ClickMouseSpline(x, y, 3, 3, True);
    end else
    begin
     Writeln('Did not find second bitmap, ending script!');
     Terminatescript;
    end;
    FreeBitmap(mine2)
end;

begin
  SetupSRL;
  LoadBitmaps;
  FindWall;
  MoveToMine;
  ClickMine;
end.

Rune hacker, thank you very much for the help!

Read full topic

item.title: Request
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

just put more bitmaps into the LoadBitmaps procedure like this:

[code]Procedure LoadBitmaps;
begin
mine := BitmapFromString(25, 3, ‘z78DA333530353071830013375’ +
‘2D92088CC4686B8D410A3DE74D45544AB070095E07015’);

blah := BitmapFromString(25, 3, ‘z78DA333530353071830013375’ +
‘2D92088CC4686B8D410A3DE74D45544AB070095E07015’);
end;[/code]

And of course each bitmap you make needs to be put into the variable area so it can be used.

Read full topic

item.title: Request
item.dc:creator: @CJg CJg
item.description:
@CJg wrote:

Alright, ive got it to find the bitmap (Thanks to you, i love you man :P) now, how would i load multiple bitmaps?

Read full topic

item.title: Request
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

To just tell it to move, use MMouse(x,y,0,0,);

And for the background, if the text you are looking for isn’t black, you can just fill the background in black. Otherwise, try this: Make a bigger bitmap of the option you want and use - (FindBitMapToleranceIn(mine, x, y, 400, 200, 516, 338, 5))
At the end, there is the #5, this is a tolerance so the color doesnt need to be exact. The higher the number, the more unaccurate it needs tro be, but if you make it too high, it will start to click other things i believe. If this doesnt work, just tell me and i will try soemthing else.

Read full topic

item.title: Request
item.dc:creator: @CJg CJg
item.description:
@CJg wrote:

Rune Hacker:

I made a bitmap tutorial in the tutorial section, and i give an example of how to use it like this.

I will go check it out, and get back to see if i can do anything with it. (Couldn’t take the time to bother learning SCAR right now, ive been working pretty hard lately.)

EDIT: My progress so far.

program Mine;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}
var
  mine : Integer;
Procedure LoadBitmaps;
  begin
  mine := BitmapFromString(25, 3, 'z78DA333530353071830013375' +
       '2D92088CC4686B8D410A3DE74D45544AB070095E07015');
end;
Procedure FindWall;
begin
  if(Findcolor(x,y,1447958, 400, 200, 516, 338))then
  begin
    Mouse(x, y, 0, 0, False);
    Wait(15000);
  end;
end;

Procedure MineTile;
begin
  if(FindBitmap(mine, x, y))then
  begin
    Mouse(x, y, 0, 0, True);
  end else
  begin
    Writeln('Did not find bitmap!');
    Terminatescript;
  end;
  FreeBitmap(mine)
end;

begin
  SetupSRL; //required to have if your using srl functions
  LoadBitmaps; //put this in your main loop so it will load the bitmap
  FindWall; //this will find the tree using the procedure we made
  MineTile;
end.

Now, my problem is that it will go and rightclick the wall fine, but the Interface is slightly transparent, so it’s different every time you click, would there be a way for it to just find the “Mining >” part, and ignore whats behind it?

Also, instead of it left clicking in the “MineTile” procedure, i need it to just move to it.

Then you for your help Rune Hacker.

Read full topic
